DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Display ACL binding summary
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: Ingress IPV6 access-list ipv6acl-example on Ethernet0 Ingress IP access-list ipacl-example on PortChannel1 Ingress MAC access-list macacl-example on Vlan100

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Display MAC ACL binding summary
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: Ingress MAC access-list macacl-example on Vlan100

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Display IPv4 ACL binding summary
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: Ingress IP access-list ipacl-example on PortChannel1

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Display IPv6 ACL binding summary
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: Ingress IPV6 access-list ipv6acl-example on Ethernet0

PARAM.name: interface
PARAM.help: Show MAC ACL counters applied on interface

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Show MAC ACL rules and statistics
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL name and interface names are optional. If ACL name is not specified then all MAC ACLs will be displayed. ACL statistics will be shown only if the ACL is applied globally or to any interface.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: mac access-list macacl-example seq 10 permit host 00:00:10:00:00:01 host 00:00:20:00:00:01 (10 packets) [1000 bytes] seq 20 permit host 00:00:10:00:00:02 host 00:00:20:00:00:02 (20 packets) [2000 bytes] seq 30 permit host 00:00:10:00:00:03 host 00:00:20:00:00:03 (30 packets) [3000 bytes] seq 40 permit host 00:00:10:00:00:04 host 00:00:20:00:00:04 (40 packets) [4000 bytes]

PARAM.name: interface
PARAM.help: Show IPv4 ACL counters applied on interface

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Show IPv4 ACL rules and statistics
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL name and interface names are optional. If ACL name is not specified then all IPv4 ACLs will be displayed. ACL statistics will be shown only if the ACL is applied globally or to any interface.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: ip access-list ipacl-example seq 10 permit ip host 10.1.1.1 host 20.1.1.1 (0 packets) [0 bytes] seq 20 permit ip host 10.1.1.2 host 20.1.1.2 (0 packets) [0 bytes] seq 30 permit ip host 10.1.1.3 host 20.1.1.3 (0 packets) [0 bytes] seq 40 permit ip host 10.1.1.4 host 20.1.1.4 (0 packets) [0 bytes]

PARAM.name: interface
PARAM.help: Show IPv6 ACL counters applied on interface

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Show IPv6 ACL rules and statistics
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL name and interface names are optional. If ACL name is not specified then all IPv6 ACLs will be displayed. ACL statistics will be shown only if the ACL is applied globally or to any interface.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: ipv6 access-list ipv6acl-example seq 100 permit ipv6 host abcd::1 host bcde::1 (0 packets) [0 bytes] seq 200 permit tcp host abcd::2 host bcde::2 (0 packets) [0 bytes] seq 300 permit udp host abcd::3 host bcde::3 (0 packets) [0 bytes]

PARAM.name: interface
PARAM.help: Clear MAC ACL counters applied on interface

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Clear MAC ACL rules statistics
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL name and interface names are optional. If ACL name is not specified then all MAC ACLs statistics will be cleared.

PARAM.name: interface
PARAM.help: Clear IPv4 ACL counters applied on interface

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Clear IPv4 ACL rules statistics
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL name and interface names are optional. If ACL name is not specified then all IPv4 ACLs statistics will be cleared.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# clear ip access-list counters ipacl-example

PARAM.name: interface
PARAM.help: Clear IPv6 ACL counters applied on interface

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Clear IPv6 ACL rules statistics
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL name and interface names are optional. If ACL name is not specified then all IPv6 ACLs statistics will be cleared.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# clear ipv6 access-list counters ipv6acl-example

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Show current MAC ACL configuration.
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL Name is optional. If no ACL name is specified then configuration for all MAC ACLs will be displayed.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Show current IPv4 ACL configuration.
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL Name is optional. If no ACL name is specified then configuration for all IPv4 ACLs will be displayed.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: ip access-list ipacl-example seq 10 permit ip host 10.1.1.1 host 20.1.1.1 seq 20 permit ip host 10.1.1.2 host 20.1.1.2 seq 30 permit ip host 10.1.1.3 host 20.1.1.3 seq 40 permit ip host 10.1.1.4 host 20.1.1.4

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Show current IPv6 ACL configuration.
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL Name is optional. If no ACL name is specified then configuration for all IPv6 ACLs will be displayed.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: ipv6 access-list ipv6acl-example seq 100 permit ipv6 host abcd::1 host bcde::1 seq 200 permit tcp host abcd::2 host bcde::2 seq 300 permit udp host abcd::3 host bcde::3

COMMAND.name: mac access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify MAC access control for packets

PARAM.name: direction-switch
PARAM.help: Configure the direction to apply the access list

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Apply MAC ACL to an interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL must be created first and must be of type MAC to be applied. Only 1 ACL of a given type can be applied per interface and per direction.

EXAMPLE.summary: Apply MAC ACL to an interface

COMMAND.name: ip access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify IP access control for packets

PARAM.name: direction-switch
PARAM.help: Configure the direction to apply the access list

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Apply IPv4 ACL to an interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL must be created first and must be of type IPv4 to be applied. Only 1 ACL of a given type can be applied per interface and per direction.

EXAMPLE.summary: Apply IPv4 ACL to an interface

COMMAND.name: ipv6 access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify IPv6 access control for packets

PARAM.name: direction-switch
PARAM.help: Configure the direction to apply the access list

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Apply IPv6 ACL to an interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL must be created first and must be of type IPv6 to be applied. Only 1 ACL of a given type can be applied per interface and per direction.

EXAMPLE.summary: Apply IPv6 ACL to an interface

COMMAND.name: no mac access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify MAC access control for packets

PARAM.name: direction-switch
PARAM.help: Configure the direction to apply the access list

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Remove MAC ACL application to an interface.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# no mac access-group macacl-example in

COMMAND.name: no ip access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify IP access control for packets

PARAM.name: direction-switch
PARAM.help: Configure the direction to apply the access list

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Remove IPv4 ACL application to an interface.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(conf-if-po1)# no ip access-group ipacl-example out

COMMAND.name: no ipv6 access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify IPv6 access control for packets

PARAM.help: Configure the direction to apply the access list

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Remove IPv6 ACL application to an interface.

PARAM.name: access-list-name
PARAM.help: Name of the MAC access-list (Max size 63)

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Create MAC ACL
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL name can be of maximum 63 characters. The name must begin with A-Z, a-z or 0-9. Underscore and hypens can be used except as the first character. ACL name must be unique across all ACL types.

PARAM.name: access-list-name
PARAM.help: Name of the IPv4 access-list (Max size 63)

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Create IPv4 ACL
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL name can be of maximum 63 characters. The name must begin with A-Z, a-z or 0-9. Underscore and hypens can be used except as the first character. ACL name must be unique across all ACL types.

PARAM.name: access-list-name
PARAM.help: Name of the IPv6 access-list (Max size 63)

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Create IPv6 ACL
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL name can be of maximum 63 characters. The name must begin with A-Z, a-z or 0-9. Underscore and hypens can be used except as the first character. ACL name must be unique across all ACL types.

PARAM.name: access-list-name
PARAM.help: Name of the MAC access-list (Max size 63)

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete MAC ACL
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL name can be of maximum 63 characters. The name must begin with A-Z, a-z or 0-9. Underscore and hypens can be used except as the first character.

PARAM.name: access-list-name
PARAM.help: Name of the IPv4 access-list (Max size 63)

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete IPv4 ACL
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL name can be of maximum 63 characters. The name must begin with A-Z, a-z or 0-9. Underscore and hypens can be used except as the first character.

PARAM.name: access-list-name
PARAM.help: Name of the IPv6 access-list (Max size 63)

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete IPv6 ACL
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL name can be of maximum 63 characters. The name must begin with A-Z, a-z or 0-9. Underscore and hypens can be used except as the first character.

COMMAND.name: mac access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify MAC access control for packets

PARAM.name: direction-switch
PARAM.help: Configure the direction to apply the access list

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Apply MAC ACL globally.
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL must be created first and must be of type MAC to be applied. Only 1 ACL of a given type can be applied globally per direction.

COMMAND.name: ip access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify IP access control for packets

PARAM.name: direction-switch
PARAM.help: Configure the direction to apply the access list

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Apply IPv4 ACL globally
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL must be created first and must be of type IPv4 to be applied. Only 1 ACL of a given type can be applied globally per direction.

COMMAND.name: ipv6 access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify IPv6 access control for packets

PARAM.name: direction-switch
PARAM.help: Configure the direction to apply the access list

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Apply IPv6 ACL globally
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL must be created first and must be of type IPv6 to be applied. Only 1 ACL of a given type can be applied globally per direction.

COMMAND.name: no mac access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify MAC access control for packets

PARAM.name: direction-switch
PARAM.help: Configure the direction to apply the access list

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Remove MAC ACL thats applied globally.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config)# no mac access-group macacl-example in

COMMAND.name: no ip access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify IP access control for packets

PARAM.name: direction-switch
PARAM.help: Configure the direction to apply the access list

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Remove IPv4 ACL thats applied globally.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config)# no ip access-group ipacl-example in

COMMAND.name: no ipv6 access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify IPv6 access control for packets

PARAM.name: direction-switch
PARAM.help: Configure the direction to apply the access list

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Remove IPv6 ACL thats applied globally.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config)# no ipv6 access-group ipv6acl-example out

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

PARAM.name: remark
PARAM.help: Clear remark or description for rule

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete ACL rule or remark associated with the rule.

COMMAND.name: remark
COMMAND.help: Set remark or description for ACL

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Set an ACL remark or description.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Remark with spaces should be mentioned in double quotes.

COMMAND.name: no remark
COMMAND.help: Clear remark or description for ACL

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete ACL remark or description.

PARAM.name: deny
PARAM.help: Do not forward the packet. Allow trap to CPU

PARAM.name: discard
PARAM.help: Do not forward the packet. Do not allow trap to CPU

PARAM.name: permit
PARAM.help: Allow packet to be forwarded and trapped to CPU

PARAM.name: transit
PARAM.help: Allow traffic to be forwarded. Do not allow trap to CPU

PARAM.name: do-not-nat
PARAM.help: Do not allow NAT processing for the packet

PARAM.name: remark
PARAM.help: Set remark or description for rule

PARAM.name: vlan
PARAM.help: Match packets using VLAN ID value

PARAM.name: remark
PARAM.help: Set remark or description for rule

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Create a MAC ACL Rule.
DOCGEN.USAGE: The rule will be created if there is no existing rule with the same sequence number. ACL Rule cant be updated. To update, the rule must be deleted and added with updated parameters.

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

PARAM.name: remark
PARAM.help: Clear remark or description for rule

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete ACL rule or remark associated with the rule.

COMMAND.name: remark
COMMAND.help: Set remark or description for ACL

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Set an ACL remark or description.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Remark with spaces should be mentioned in double quotes.

COMMAND.name: no remark
COMMAND.help: Clear remark or description for ACL

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete ACL remark or description.

PARAM.name: deny
PARAM.help: Do not forward the packet. Allow trap to CPU

PARAM.name: discard
PARAM.help: Do not forward the packet. Do not allow trap to CPU

PARAM.name: permit
PARAM.help: Allow packet to be forwarded and trapped to CPU

PARAM.name: transit
PARAM.help: Allow traffic to be forwarded. Do not allow trap to CPU

PARAM.name: do-not-nat
PARAM.help: Do not allow NAT processing for the packet

PARAM.name: remark
PARAM.help: Set remark or description for rule

PARAM.name: src-eq
PARAM.help: Match packets with TCP/UDP source port equal to the given port number

PARAM.name: src-gt
PARAM.help: Match packets with TCP/UDP source port greater than the given port number

PARAM.name: src-lt
PARAM.help: Match packets with TCP/UDP source port lesser than the given port number

PARAM.name: src-range
PARAM.help: Match packets with TCP/UDP source port in the given range

PARAM.name: src-port2
PARAM.help: Source port end. Must be greater than source port begin.

PARAM.name: dst-eq
PARAM.help: Match packets with TCP/UDP destination port equal to the given port number

PARAM.name: dst-gt
PARAM.help: Match packets with TCP/UDP destination port greater than the given port number

PARAM.name: dst-lt
PARAM.help: Match packets with TCP/UDP destination port lesser than the given port number

PARAM.name: dst-range
PARAM.help: Match packets with TCP/UDP destination port in the given range

PARAM.name: dst-port2
PARAM.help: Destination port end. Must be greater than destination port begin.

PARAM.name: default
PARAM.help: Match packets with CS0 DSCP (000000 - Decimal value 0)

PARAM.name: cs1
PARAM.help: Match packets with CS1 DSCP (001000 - Decimal value 8)

PARAM.name: cs2
PARAM.help: Match packets with CS2 DSCP (010000 - Decimal value 16)

PARAM.name: cs3
PARAM.help: Match packets with CS3 DSCP (011000 - Decimal value 24)

PARAM.name: cs4
PARAM.help: Match packets with CS4 DSCP (100000 - Decimal value 32)

PARAM.name: cs5
PARAM.help: Match packets with CS5 DSCP (101000 - Decimal value 40)

PARAM.name: cs6
PARAM.help: Match packets with CS6 DSCP (110000 - Decimal value 48)

PARAM.name: cs7
PARAM.help: Match packets with CS7 DSCP (111000 - Decimal value 56)

PARAM.name: af11
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF11 DSCP (001010 - Decimal value 10)

PARAM.name: af12
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF12 DSCP (001100 - Decimal value 12)

PARAM.name: af13
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF13 DSCP (001110 - Decimal value 14)

PARAM.name: af21
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF21 DSCP (010010 - Decimal value 18)

PARAM.name: af22
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF22 DSCP (010100 - Decimal value 20)

PARAM.name: af23
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF23 DSCP (010110 - Decimal value 22)

PARAM.name: af31
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF31 DSCP (011010 - Decimal value 26)

PARAM.name: af32
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF32 DSCP (011100 - Decimal value 28)

PARAM.name: af33
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF33 DSCP (011110 - Decimal value 30)

PARAM.name: af41
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF41 DSCP (100010 - Decimal value 34)

PARAM.name: af42
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF42 DSCP (100100 - Decimal value 36)

PARAM.name: af43
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF43 DSCP (100110 - Decimal value 38)

PARAM.name: ef
PARAM.help: Match packets with EF DSCP (101110 - Decimal value 46)

PARAM.name: voice-admit
PARAM.help: Match packets with VOICE-ADMIT DSCP (101100 - Decimal value 44)

PARAM.name: tcp-established
PARAM.help: Match packets which are part of established TCP session

PARAM.name: fin
PARAM.help: Match packets with FIN TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-fin
PARAM.help: Match packets with FIN TCP flag cleared

PARAM.name: syn
PARAM.help: Match packets with SYN TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-syn
PARAM.help: Match packets with SYN TCP Flag cleared

PARAM.name: rst
PARAM.help: Match packets with RST TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-rst
PARAM.help: Match packets with RST TCP flag cleared

PARAM.name: psh
PARAM.help: Match packets with PSH TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-psh
PARAM.help: Match packets with PSH TCP flag cleared

PARAM.name: ack
PARAM.help: Match packets with ACK TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-ack
PARAM.help: Match packets with ACK TCP flag cleared

PARAM.name: urg
PARAM.help: Match packets with URG TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-urg
PARAM.help: Match packets with URG TCP flag cleared

PARAM.name: vlan
PARAM.help: Match packets using VLAN ID value

PARAM.name: remark
PARAM.help: Set remark or description for rule

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Create a IPv4 ACL Rule.
DOCGEN.USAGE: The rule will be created if there is no existing rule with the same sequence number. ACL Rule cant be updated. To update, the rule must be deleted and added with updated parameters.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config-ip-acl)# seq 10 permit ip host 10.1.1.1 host 20.1.1.1

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

PARAM.name: remark

COMMAND.help: Set remark or description for ACL

DOCGEN.USAGE: Remark with spaces should be mentioned in double quotes.

COMMAND.help: Clear remark or description for ACL

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete ACL remark or description.

PARAM.help: Match packets with AF22 DSCP (010100 - Decimal value 20)

PARAM.name: af23
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF23 DSCP (010110 - Decimal value 22)

PARAM.name: af31
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF31 DSCP (011010 - Decimal value 26)

PARAM.name: af32
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF32 DSCP (011100 - Decimal value 28)

PARAM.name: af33
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF33 DSCP (011110 - Decimal value 30)

PARAM.name: af41
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF41 DSCP (100010 - Decimal value 34)

PARAM.name: af42
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF42 DSCP (100100 - Decimal value 36)

PARAM.name: af43
PARAM.help: Match packets with AF43 DSCP (100110 - Decimal value 38)

PARAM.name: ef
PARAM.help: Match packets with EF DSCP (101110 - Decimal value 46)

PARAM.name: voice-admit
PARAM.help: Match packets with VOICE-ADMIT DSCP (101100 - Decimal value 44)

PARAM.name: tcp-established
PARAM.help: Match packets which are part of established TCP session

PARAM.name: fin
PARAM.help: Match packets with FIN TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-fin
PARAM.help: Match packets with FIN TCP flag cleared

PARAM.name: syn
PARAM.help: Match packets with SYN TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-syn
PARAM.help: Match packets with SYN TCP Flag cleared

PARAM.name: rst
PARAM.help: Match packets with RST TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-rst
PARAM.help: Match packets with RST TCP flag cleared

PARAM.name: psh
PARAM.help: Match packets with PSH TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-psh
PARAM.help: Match packets with PSH TCP flag cleared

PARAM.name: ack
PARAM.help: Match packets with ACK TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-ack
PARAM.help: Match packets with ACK TCP flag cleared

PARAM.name: urg
PARAM.help: Match packets with URG TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-urg
PARAM.help: Match packets with URG TCP flag cleared

PARAM.name: vlan
PARAM.help: Match packets using VLAN ID value

PARAM.name: remark
PARAM.help: Set remark or description for rule

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Create a IPv6 ACL Rule.
DOCGEN.USAGE: The rule will be created if there is no existing rule with the same sequence number. ACL Rule cant be updated. To update, the rule must be deleted and added with updated parameters.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config-ip-acl)# seq 100 permit ipv6 host abcd::1 host bcde::1
